text: The Har Homa settlement is an Israeli settlement in the West Bank, located north of the city of Bethlehem () on Mount Abu Ghneim (). It is also called the Abu Ghneim settlement () or the Jabal Abu Ghneim settlement (). In the mid-nineties, Israel began establishing the settlement amid widespread popular Palestinian opposition, Palestinian efforts through the occupation courts, and calls for international intervention. In 2013, its population reached 25,000 people. Homat Shmuel == References ==
title: Har Homa
